subject: Productivity
title: The Representativeness Heuristic
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Representativeness Heuristic.

hook.text: Linda is outspoken and studied philosophy. Is she more likely a bank teller or a feminist bank teller?

buildup.text: Most people say feminist bank teller. That's mathematically impossible â€” the subset can't exceed the set.

discovery.text: The representativeness heuristic judges probability by how much something resembles a stereotype.

twist.text: This shortcut ignores base rates. Rare categories get inflated because they fit the story better.

climax.text: Asking about base rates before judging â€” how common is this category? â€” corrects the error.

punchline.text: A good story isn't the same as a likely one.

quiz.question: What does the representativeness heuristic do?
options: Judges probability by resemblance to a stereotype
